channel.title: Cheap windows 7 disk?
channel.description: Where can I get a cheap windows 7 disk?

item.title: Cheap windows 7 disk?
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Just go here for official direct downloads. I used these because my restore discs were fucked and never worked in the beginning, so I had to have a disc (i have a legit key though, so yea). I’m sure you can find a keygen somewhere for a key, the use WATRemover to “activate” it, in a sense.

Read full topic

item.title: Cheap windows 7 disk?
item.dc:creator: @Daginith Daginith
item.description:
@Daginith wrote:

[quote=“t4, post:17, topic:440942”][quote author=Daginith link=topic=543620.msg3984586#msg3984586 date=1335730550]

or get the windows 8 beta. I just cleared a HDD on one of my computers and put it on it. Sure its different, but its not that bad once u get used to it

http://windows.microsoft.com/en-US/windows-8/download

does it have full functionality?

everything i wanted to do, i could do on it so far (Except run windows XP games, lol)

WINE won’t run the setup anyways

Meh. Just try Win8 out…oh yeah you will need to have a MSN account too, but thats it i think.

if you have a legitimate windows 7 activation key i see no harm in torrenting the correct ISO (pro, home) and burning it to a blank.

Most torrents are fucked up. Took me a week to find a legit windows XP one

Also (well with WinXP) they keep the activation key in plain text in the .iso…

uncompile the .iso
go to the file i686 (or something close)
there is a file named unused.txt (or something close…)
and the last line is the Product key. Not sure if it is the same with Win7…
[/quote]
wat @ fucked up torrents and wat @ uncompile an iso[/quote]
Idk, took me like a week to find a complete download of WinXP. Most would stop halfway or some shit.

And I didnt know what to call it. Maybe not uncompile, jut open with winrar or 7z…
so you can see all the files in there

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Muroth Muroth
item.description:
@Muroth wrote:

i wouldn’t get the license key of torrented ISOs because they most likely have already been used and will make you enter a different key

if you have a legitimate windows 7 activation key i see no harm in torrenting the correct ISO (pro, home) and burning it to a blank.

Most torrents are fucked up. Took me a week to find a legit windows XP one

Also (well with WinXP) they keep the activation key in plain text in the .iso…

uncompile the .iso
go to the file i686 (or something close)
there is a file named unused.txt (or something close…)
and the last line is the Product key. Not sure if it is the same with Win7…[/quote]

item.title: Cheap windows 7 disk?
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

Daginith:

Most torrents are fucked up. Took me a week to find a legit windows XP one

Oh that’s strange. When I burned XP I found it in 30 seconds. On TPB you just have to sort by the most seeders and the top one is almost always what you’re looking for.

Read full topic

item.title: Cheap windows 7 disk?
item.dc:creator: @Daginith Daginith
item.description:
@Daginith wrote:

ultimatepkvillage:

do not torrent, because you will end up not having a computer because you will need a licenses key

For win7 that may be so, but i bet there are a few keys out there.
For WinXP its included in the files.
For Win8 Microsoft gives it to you.

Not a whole lot that can go wrong.
